title: Katarina's rework is bad.
body:
You are going to make her QWE damage really REALLY low, for a little bit more of mobility. She is squishy and easy to focus with targeted abilities, so is not like she will shunpo 10 times in a fight.
She is fine after her ult base damage nerf. She has clear counters and strenghts.

Katarina takes considerable skill to play outside of Bronze, where CC is an elusive myth. Don't bother contesting that point, I don't care what you have to say and reasonable players dont actually think it's up for debate.

I will concede that many of her counters have been nerfed out of playability though. 

Talon and Diana specifically.

My problem with this is they seem to want you to build her like a hybrid, but the hybrid items are terrible outside of gunblade. I'm waiting to see what else they do to this rework and what her ultimate looks like, but right now she just looks like a build mess.
Gunblade is a horribly designed item too. It is one of the biggest reasons why Akali is so cancerous to play against.
And they're also nerfing gunblade. Maybe there's some master plan here, but all I see is a slew of unrelated and random nerfs that do nothing to enhance game health.

People have to realize how hard this is  going to hurt Katarina's laning phase. Katarina is very easy to bully in lane and she has to rely on her q and w damage for csing and for poking. The nerf to these two abilities will make laning as her so much harder than it already it is. Plus the rework on her w and e is extremely stupid as you should never be building on ad on katarina when ap provides so much more damage. This "rework" is just sending Katarina into the Eve category where she will not have a clear identity, by which I mean, is she an assassin? fighter? Bc the only way to make her laning phase viable, is by building ad. But your mid game will suffer tremendously. I understand it is very hard to try and nerf Katarina due to the nature of her kit, and I agree she is in need of a slight one ( I am a Kat main), but in order to truly truly rework her and keep her as an assassin, you have to change her whole entire kit. Lowering damage won't solve anything on a champion based off of getting resets on kills and assists. And to be completely  fair, removing DFG might have been the nerf she needed as it has become quite the staple item on core katarina players, so I don't think they should really try to do anything until after a few weeks of the implementation of DFG's removal.

Personally, I think it's a great rework.

It gives Katarina some more depth as a champion, requiring people to play her a bit more carefully rather than being rewarded for recklessly engaging a 4 man team and earning a quadra in .5 seconds.

There isn't anything reckless or random about playing Katarina. 


Everything about her engage is careful. 


Timing is everything. If you don't understand that you simply don't understand the champion.
This. So much this. The same rules may not apply to lower ELO, but in average/high, this right here.

It's not wrong, it takes a great deal of practice and timing to get to be a good Kat, but the problem with her right now is that a good Kat and a bad Kat are both using the same move chain in the same way. The only real difference is a good Kat finds the timing and runs with it, while a bad Kat gropes blindly for it until she gets fat enough to start rolling.

Also what changes are we referring to? Hasn't she been reworked once already?

If they just keep the damage on her shunpo and leave this cooldown buff on I think it would be appropriate compensation for removal of DFG. 
But the way it is currently, it's pretty dumb, I agree.

Assuming these changes went through, she would have no real place. She is stuck between AoE damager, between being AP and AD, and her damage has been nerfed so that she can not be an assassin.

Then what is she? She serves no utility, and CC easily counters her. Mobility is nice and all (although Shunpo already gave her enough, especially with resets), but what is the point if you are just going to move around dealing no damage and giving no utility?

I also do not really see it as "more mobility," considering it is situational, since Shunpo must be landed on a champion for its cooldown to be decreased.

I disagree with these changes, and would see it not as an improvement. I think of Katarina as a champion who is balanced (obvious strengths: burst, AoE, mobility with resets... weaknesses: no CC, shutdown by CC, weak early, no more DFG)

The weaknesses you give for Kat can be overcome. Her lack of CC can be supplemented by that of allies (e.g. Leona); she can play safer in early game and roam to other lanes for her kills if her own lane gets problematic; DFG was getting toxic anyway, and other champs are getting compensated for it as well; and CC shuts down most everyone.

It's not an improvement, true, but I see it as less of a nerf and more of a change in playstyle (i.e. she needs to go in more for damage and better plan her engage).

the destruction of karma wasn't as bad as people like to hog it up to be. It just made her a better solo laner than a support. Also, I really dislike how people think all Kat players have to do is mash buttons or just E into a fight, press some buttons and get out of it. Kat is very predictable, especially if you have wards map ( none apparent in lower tiers) and she is more heavily punished by cc than most champions, nor is her assassination as quick as other assassins. Especially with the removal of DFG. I'm also tired of people complaining about how much damage she does. She is an assassin! She is supposed to do a lot of burst damage with a lot of risk, of which she has ( go in a second too late or a second too early and you EASILY can cost your team the teamfight).  To me, it seems that people just want the removal of the assassin role in general. I'm sorry you guys have to play against champions that actually take skill and forethought to play against.
